medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at age 9 with severe hypertension, low birth weight, and subsequent mild to moderate hypertensive retinopathy developing at age 12. Symptoms have been characterized by minimal response to dietary salt restriction and subsequent improvement with spironolactone treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Low birth weight (2.0 kg at 36 weeks gestation), hypokalemic metabolic alkalosis, suppressed aldosterone, bilateral nephrocalcinosis.
medical_history.family_history: Significant for consanguinity; maternal family members with hypertension include the mother, maternal grandmother, and maternal uncle.
